newsitem.title: ITALY: June a key month for Italy deficit data -employers.
newsitem.headline: June a key month for Italy deficit data -employers.

text.p: June will be a key month for understanding whether Italy is on course to meet its 1997 deficit goal, employers' federation Confindustria said in a survey released on Wednesday.
It said data from the first five months of the year were in line with a target to cut the deficit to three percent of gross domestic product (GDP) from 6.7 percent in 1997.

"(But) the June data appears crucial," the report said. "To confirm the recent trend, it is necessary for Italy to record a budget surplus of some five to six trillion lire above the 25.6 trillion lire surplus seen in June 1996."
Italy traditionally carries a surplus in June thanks to a bulk of tax returns falling due during the month.
Italy chalked up a 54.95 trillion lire deficit between January and May, around 24 trillion lire less than the same period last year. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
